Class SimpleBoard

java.lang.Object
com.comp2042.logic.board.SimpleBoard
All Implemented Interfaces:
Board
public class SimpleBoard extends Object implements Board
Concrete implementation of the Board interface representing the standard Tetris grid.

This class serves as the core Model component for the gameplay physics. It manages:

  • The 2D integer matrix representing the grid state (0 for empty, values for colors).
  • The active falling Brick and its coordinates.
  • Collision detection logic (walls, floor, and other blocks).
  • Complex mechanics like Wall Kicks (SRS) and Hard Drops.

It delegates mathematical matrix operations to MatrixOperations to keep this class focused on game rules.

  • Constructor Details

    • SimpleBoard

      public SimpleBoard(int height, int width)
      Constructs a new board with specific dimensions. Initializes the brick generator and spawner.
      Parameters:
      height - the number of rows (including hidden rows)
      width - the number of columns

  • Method Details

    • restoreState

      public void restoreState(int[][] savedGrid)
      Overwrites the current board matrix with a saved state. This allows the Memento Pattern to "undo" moves.
      Specified by:
      restoreState in interface Board
      Parameters:
      savedGrid - the matrix state to restore

    • resetCurrentBrick

      public void resetCurrentBrick()
      Resets the active brick to the top-center spawn position. Used when refreshing the game state or undoing a move.
      Specified by:
      resetCurrentBrick in interface Board

    • holdCurrentBrick

      public boolean holdCurrentBrick()
      Swaps the current falling brick with the held brick.

      If no brick is held, the current brick is stored and a new one spawns. If a swap occurs, the brick position resets to the spawn point. The hold action can only be performed once per turn.

      Specified by:
      holdCurrentBrick in interface Board
      Returns:
      true if the new/swapped brick immediately collides (Game Over condition)

    • createNewBrick

      public boolean createNewBrick()
      Spawns a new random brick from the generator at the top of the board.
      Specified by:
      createNewBrick in interface Board
      Returns:
      true if the new brick immediately collides with existing blocks (Game Over)

    • getStartX

      private int getStartX()
      Calculates the horizontal center for spawning new bricks. Uses config offsets to align correctly.

    • newGame

      public void newGame()
      Resets the entire board state for a new game. Clears the matrix, hold slot, and generates a fresh brick.
      Specified by:
      newGame in interface Board

    • getViewData

      public ViewData getViewData()
      Packages the current game state into a ViewData object for the UI. Includes calculations for the "Ghost Piece" (where the block would land).
      Specified by:
      getViewData in interface Board
      Returns:
      a snapshot of the board, active piece, and next pieces

    • tryMove

      private boolean tryMove(int dx, int dy)
      Helper method to attempt a move. Checks collision using MatrixOperations.intersect(int[][], int[][], int, int).
      Parameters:
      dx - change in x
      dy - change in y
      Returns:
      true if move valid and applied

    • rotateLeftBrick

      public boolean rotateLeftBrick()
      Rotates the brick counter-clockwise with SRS (Super Rotation System) wall kicks. Attempts to rotate; if blocked, tries specific offset positions (kicks) to find a valid fit.
      Specified by:
      rotateLeftBrick in interface Board
      Returns:
      true if rotation was successful

    • getBoardMatrix

      public int[][] getBoardMatrix()
      Description copied from interface: Board
      Retrieves the raw 2D array representing the locked blocks on the board. Used by observers to render the background.
      Specified by:
      getBoardMatrix in interface Board
      Returns:
      a 2D integer array where values represent color codes (0 is empty).

      Specified by:
      isDangerState in interface Board
